saves.title: Basking in a New Holiday Glow, No Evergreen Needed
saves.abstract: A lighting installation by the designer David Rockwell seeks to make the Winter Garden in Lower Manhattan a destination to rival New York’s most famous Christmas tree.

multimedia.caption: Every time someone interacts with one of the ground-level cubes, Brookfield will make a donation to a program run by the Grammy Foundation that supports music programs in schools.

saves.title: Cartoon: Heng on China-Africa Ties
saves.abstract: President Xi Jinping is scheduled to visit Zimbabwe and South Africa early next month.

saves.title: Breyer Sees Value in U.S. Supreme Court’s Looking to Foreign Law
saves.abstract: Justice Stephen G. Breyer suggests the court should check abroad for guidance because about 20 percent of cases are affected by what happens outside the United States.
saves.byline: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

multimedia.caption: Justice Stephen G. Breyer, at his home in Cambridge, Mass., says that in an interdependent world, the court “must increasingly consider foreign and domestic law together."
Justice Stephen G. Breyer, at his home in Cambridge, Mass., says that in an interdependent world, the court “must increasingly consider foreign and domestic law together."

saves.title: Murdoch’s British Tabloids Clean Up Their Acts
saves.abstract: A decade after a phone-hacking scandal exposed a pattern of illicit information-gathering, the unspoken laws of tabloids have been reconfigured.
des_facet: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

saves.title: Review: In ‘Gluten!’ the Fashion Is in the Hazmat Suits
saves.abstract: This dystopian comedy by Stephen Kaliski at 59E59 Theaters follows a couple apartment hunting after half the population has died from environmental toxicity.

saves.title: Andy Murray Propels Britain to Victory in the Davis Cup
saves.abstract: The world’s No. 2 player capped an emotional tournament by beating David Goffin of Belgium in straight sets, giving Britain first title in 79 years.

saves.title: Peeling Back the Layers of Born Salesman’s Life
saves.abstract: A career criminal and con artist, Michael Forman, had been in and out of prisons most of his adult life. But he could tell a story.
